title: Heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says the low-pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal is very likely to continue to move west-northwestwards towards the Tamil Nadu coast close to Northern Sri Lanka during the next 24 hours.

title: South Korean police search President Yoon’s office over martial law imposition, reports say
byline: Yonhap news agency says police are searching President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office.

title: Adani Ports withdraws DFC funding request for Colombo port project
byline: India’s Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd said on Tuesday it would finance its Colombo port terminal project through internal accruals and a capital management plan, withdrawing its request for funding from the US International Development Finance Corp (DFC).

title: CEB purchased thermal power despite surplus hydro and coal reserves?
byline: The Technical Engineers and Supervisors Association of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) allege that the state-owned electricity provider has procured electricity from private thermal power plants, even as reservoir levels associated with hydro-power plants are at their maximum as a result of recent heavy rainfall.

title: Israel targets Syria: 480 strikes in 48 hours after Assad’s ouster
byline: The Israeli military announced on Tuesday that it conducted approximately 480 airstrikes over the past 48 hours, targeting key military installations across Syria.

title: Insurance regulation in Sri Lanka ‘developing with limited transparency’: Fitch Ratings
byline: Sri Lanka’s regulatory environment for the insurance sector is regarded as “developing with limited transparency,” according to Fitch Ratings.

title: S Korea ex-minister linked to martial law move attempts to take his life
byline: South Korea’s former defence minister Kim Yong-hyun, who claimed responsibility for the president’s failed attempt to place the country under martial law last week, has tried to take his own life, an official said.
